Meet The Little 8-Pound Shih Tzu Mix Who is Looking For Love
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Cheddar Biscuit, a little Shih Tzu mix who is searching for his forever home. Not much information was given on Cheddar’s life before coming into rescue care, besides the fact that he comes from down South in Mississippi. Once he came into Great Dog Rescue New England’s care, Cheddar Biscuit was placed with a loving foster family, where he can wait in safety and comfort until the day comes when he meets his new forever family.

This 3.5-Month-Old Puppy Is Dog, Cat, & Kid Friendly, So Why Is He Still Waiting?
Sandy Paws Rescue Inc., a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, recently shared that Surya, an adorable 3.5-month-old puppy, is awaiting his forever home. Despite his charming personality and adaptable nature, the rescue reports that Surya is "STILL waiting for an application that's a good fit for him!" Expected to grow into a small to medium-sized adult dog, Surya comes from a mixed-breed mother weighing approximately 30 pounds. The rescue enthusiastically describes him as a "GREAT little puppy who can fit in seamlessly to almost any type of household," highlighting his excellent sleeping habits, playful demeanor, and affectionate nature.

Parents of missing 7-month-old Emmanuel Haro arrested for murder
UPDATE: The San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department released a statement on the arrest of Jake and Rebecca Haro in the disappearance of their 7-month-old son Emmanuel Haro. “This investigation began on August 14, 2025, as a reported kidnapping at the Big 5 in Yucaipa. The San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department immediately dedicated all available resources to locate seven-month-old Emmanuel Haro. During the investigation thus far, numerous interviews have been conducted, search warrants have been served, digital and electronic evidence has been collected and closely analyzed. Based on the evidence, investigators determined a kidnapping in Yucaipa did not occur. It is believed Emmanuel is deceased and the search to recover his remains is ongoing,” according to the advisory.

Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Mallory, a sweet little mix pup seeking her forever home. While Mallory’s origins remain shrouded in mystery, her Petfinder profile indicates that at some point she found herself living at a shelter. “This sweet & silky girl was rescued from a local shelter in Georgia,” GDRNE states. Since coming into Great Dog Rescue New England’s care, Mallory has been transferred to a loving foster home where she will remain until the day comes when she meets her new forever family, and her life can truly begin.

Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Bella Butterfly, a 6-year-old mix girl seeking her forever home after an unfortunate life change. Until recently, Bella was living in a home with a family of her very own. However, according to the rescue, “She was surrendered to us in Mississippi by a family who could no longer care for her.” Now living with a loving foster family, “This sweet girl is ready to find a new family to call her own!”

This Apple Pie Turnover Recipe Is Pure Fall Comfort in Every Bite
These Apple Pie Turnovers are a delicious and easy twist on the classic apple pie. Made with crescent roll dough and stuffed with thinly sliced Granny Smith apples, this recipe brings all the warm flavors of apple pie into bite-sized turnovers. The addition of a sweet sauce made from butter, sugar, and spices, combined with a splash of whiskey and Sprite, makes these turnovers irresistible. Best served warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, they are perfect for dessert or even a sweet breakfast treat.

Meet The Sweet Dogs Who Are Searching for a New Home Together After Their Owner Passes Away
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Lucy and Sammie, a bonded pair of female dogs seeking their forever home after tragedy struck. According to GDRNE, “These girls have been together since they were puppies and are able to adapt to any situation thrown their way.” Their known origins began in Alabama where they lived in a corner lot of a busy intersection. They moved to the Northeast with their previous loving owners and adapted quickly to a new lifestlye. Sadly, their owner recently passed away, leaving these girls homeless and in need of help.

Mexico Travel: New Warnings for US Citizens by State Department
The US State Department has increased its warnings to US citizens about travel to Mexico. On August 12, 2025, the State Department issued a "Level 2 - Exercise Increased Caution" advisory covering the entire country to US citizens travelling to Mexico, and added "Terrorism" as a "risk indicator" for the first time alongside previously issued warnings about "Crime" and "Kidnapping or Hostage Taking" to the threats US travelers to Mexico could face.

This Injured Mother Dog Was Found as a Stray But Kept Her Puppies Healthy
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Frannie Fabulous, a young Boxer mix girl who came into rescue care under very difficult circumstances. When Frannie was originally found, she was living as a stray along with her two puppies. While in the difficult position of raising two babies while also trying to find enough food to survive each day, Frannie was injured when rescuers found her. “We are so happy we found them when we did because Miss Frannie also had an injured hip and leg on her left side.” Despite the pain she was in, Frannie managed to keep both her babies well-fed and healthy during their time on the streets.

A divided Wyoming community, reeling from a tormented wolf and deluge of threats, braces for Cody Roberts’ prosecution
PINEDALE—Kari DeWitt knew she was signing herself up for unpleasant times by talking with a journalist. But the 14-year Sublette County resident, office worker and mother of three, did just that, sharing words in support of Cody Roberts.
